div.div: Welcome to Chireno Independent School District

p.style: margin: 0px; display: inline;
color: rgb(32, 18, 77); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.style: margin: 0px; display: inline;

br.style: color: rgb(32, 18, 77); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: rgb(32, 18, 77); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

p.style: color: rgb(32, 18, 77); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Chireno schools will remain closed through the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year in accordance with Governor Abbott’s executive order on April 17th. Students must continue to receive daily academic support from their teachers and schools for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. I will be looking at options for our graduation ceremony to honor and celebrate our graduating seniors.

p.style: margin: 0px; display: inline;

br.style: color: rgb(32, 18, 77); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

p.style: color: rgb(32, 18, 77); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: We will continue to provide instruction through distance learning during this time. We will have packet pickup and dropoff on Monday April 20th. We also will be providing the grading guidelines for both elementary and secondary. Food services will resume providing the weekly meals on Monday for pickup. Please continue to check our district website and Facebook page for the latest information.

br.br:
SOCIAL DISTANCING! CLICK HERE TO SEE WHAT YOU SHOULD DO!
Let's work together to fight COVID-19. Head to http://tea.texas.gov/staywell for vitally important public health guidance to stop the spread. If we stand apart as a community now, we will be together again soon.

span.span: Student learning packets for the extended school closure of April 6th-April 17th will be distributed this Friday 7:30 a.m.- 5:30 p.m., drive-thru style in front of the high school entrance.

br.span: There will be a drop box available to return packets from the first two weeks of the school closure. Please return completed portions of each packet.

strong.span: Dear Chireno ISD Community and Family,

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

br.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial;

strong.span: Chireno schools will remain closed until Monday May 4th to Honor Governor Abbott’s executive order and to keep our students, staff and community members safe during this pandemic. We will continue to offer instruction through packet pick- up this Friday from 7:30 am - 5:30 pm. You will also be able to return the previous two week’s work so teachers can grade and give feedback at those times as well. We will continue to offer meals to students 18 and under each week, with pick up on Mondays from 11:00 am - 1:00 pm while supplies are available.

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;

strong.span: Please continue to check the district website and district Facebook page for the latest information. We appreciate your patience during these troubling times.

em.strong: Social & Emotional Resources from Mrs. Pinner

div.style: border-width: 0px; position: absolute; overflow: hidden; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; left: 0px; top: 3px; width: 1px; height: 1px;

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px;

div.p:
Good Evening!
We hope our entire CISD Family and Community is well! Thank you for the many emails and messages of support as we put plans in place to support you during the school closure. Please continue to reach out and let us know how we may serve you.
Many of you have asked what you can do to help. Right now, the answer is simple-just check on each other. Call your neighbor and offer a word of encouragement. Remind each other it's okay to make your at home "classroom" rules as you go. Find what works best for your family. Please make every effort to follow the recommendations for limiting the spread of COVID-19.
If you can, say a prayer for your school leaders. We're trying to make decisions based on many unknown factors, with information that is rapidly evolving. Balancing short term needs, with the potential long-term impact is especially challenging. One thing is for sure, if our children are not healthy-physically and emotionally, nothing else really matters.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px;

div.p:
Sincerely,
Heather Hagle

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px;

div.p: This week's events:

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px;

div.p:
Monday, March 23rd
7:30 a.m.-7:30 p.m.
Instructional support packets available drive-thru style in front of the high school. Stay in your vehicle and we'll bring your family's packets out to you.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px;

div.p:
11:00 a.m.-12:00 p.m.
Lunch will be available for children ages 1-18 in drive-thru style. Follow the road behind the high school and to the back of the cafeteria. We'll deliver to your car.

p.style: margin: 6px 0px 0px; display: inline; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(29, 33, 41); font-size: 14px;

div.p:
Tuesday, March 24th
11:00 a.m.-1:00 p.m.
Child meals will be bundled for the rest of the week (Tuesday-Friday). Meals may be picked up in the same drive-thru style as Monday.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: 12.8000001907349px; font-family: arial, sans-serif;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: 12.8000001907349px; font-family: arial, sans-serif;

div.p:
Chireno ISD will provide a safe learning environment where
students will recognize the value of life-long education and
will become leaders with an intense drive for excellence.

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: 12.8000001907349px; font-family: arial, sans-serif;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: 12.8000001907349px; font-family: arial, sans-serif;
color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: 12.8000001907349px; font-family: arial, sans-serif;

div.p: Chireno ISD is a composite of many people--its students and their families, its employees, and its community--who recognize that excellence is the standard by which all teaching and learning must be measured.While each student in Chireno ISD is valued as an individual, excellent educational opportunities for all students must be ensured. Chireno ISD will provide a pleasant, safe environment where each student will develop the skills necessary to be a productive citizen of the Twenty-first Century. Teachers will serve as facilitators who enable students to think critically, and to synthesize and evaluate information. Teachers will promote respect and self-esteem for everyone. Chireno ISD will provide a core curriculum which includes the most current technology as an integral component. The goal of all school activities will be high student achievement. To this end, teachers will build collegial and collaborative relationships with fellow professionals and other adults of the District.Parents and community members will know their knowledge, experiences, and opinions are respected. They will support the District and its students through active involvement in classrooms, programs, and organizations. Chireno ISD students will recognize the value of life-long education and will become leaders with an intense drive for excellence.

Chireno HS
Phone: 936-362-2132 ext. 101
